item.title: Fibonacci Equation for Zth (Nth) Term Using Pascal's Triangle (Part 1 of 2)
item.description: If you're familiar with the intricacies of Pascal's Triangle, see how I did it by going to part 2. (Part 2 not complete yet) Background of Pascal's Triangle A while back, I was reintroduced to Pascal's Triangle by my pre-calculus teacher. Pascal's triangle can be written as an infintely expanding triangle, with each term being generated as the sum of the two numbers adjacently above it. For example, both \(10\)s in the triangle below are the sum of \(6\) and \(4\).
